instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not going to sleep when closing lid.
threads.message:
this board came in with classic <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> problem ( crashing intermittently ).
after <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> problem, customer came a few weeks later with not going to sleep when closing the lid problem.
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3.4v.
using another known good logicboard in the case, the sleep work, so we can discard part problem.

everytime  i plug magsafe, <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> isgetting warm, and sometimes theres a fan spin ( even though i dont press / trigger power button ).
any idea where to look for ?
is the keyboard button stuck hence mac wont go to sleep?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not going to sleep when closing lid.
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R8750</RESISTOR> is corroded, re tin the resistor, value is normal. but still same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not going to sleep when closing lid.
threads.message:
Hall sensor is placed into BIL, connected to J6955.
Check <RESISTOR>R6961</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not going to sleep when closing lid.
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R6961</RESISTOR> is good, there's 3.3v at both side.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not going to sleep when closing lid.
threads.message:
Should drop to 0V, when lid is closed.
You can test approaching a magnet to the sensor placed on the BIL.
If another MLB worked on the same shell, then the sensor is good.

Should have bad trace, or contact problem at J6955.
Don't forget to check <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> contacts...
